content.question:
A pharmaceutical company is examining the relationship between dosage of a new pain-relief medication and the time it takes for patients to experience pain relief from a headache. Various dosages ranging from 200 to 1,200 milligrams (<math alttext="m g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>mg</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>) in 100-milligram increments were given to 41 randomly selected patients, and the time until relief was measured in minutes. A check of the conditions necessary for inference for the slope of a regression line shows that they are met.

A 95 percent confidence interval for the slope of the regression line relating the dosage, <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, to the time until relief, <math alttext="y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></math>, is given by <math alttext="negative 4.15 comma negative 2.27" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>4.15</mn></mrow></mrow><mo>,</mo><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2.27</mn></mrow></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>.

Based on the confidence interval, which of the following claims is supported?

choices.label: A 100 <math alttext="milligram" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>mg</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> increase in dosage results in a decrease in the time until relief by more than two minutes on average.

A 100 <math alttext="milligram" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>mg</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> increase in dosage results in a decrease in the time until relief by more than four minutes on average.
There is not a linear relationship between dosage and time until relief.

A 100 <math alttext="milligram" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>mg</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> increase in dosage results in an increase in the time until relief by more than two minutes on average.

A 100 <math alttext="milligram" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>mg</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> increase in dosage results in an increase in the time until relief by more than four minutes on average.

content.answer: A 100 <math alttext="milligram" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>mg</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> increase in dosage results in a decrease in the time until relief by more than two minutes on average.
